content.description:
Really fun route with a variation of moves.

Easiest to climb left of the main roof and a bit harder if you go straight up through the roof.
content.location: Third route to the right (east) of Millennium Wall, about 100-feet east of the last route on Corn Wall.

content.description: High-step off the ground and move up on positive, but slopey holds.  Eventually move left toward a crack, then back right and past a huge pocket.  Enjoy awesome gas pockets as you romp to the top.
content.location: Far right end of the Millennium Wall, just before The Hen House

content.description: Fun climbing similar to Y2K Crash in style and difficulty
Step left near the start and pull a cruxy move (some might call it a lunge), then continue up slightly easier terrain.
content.location: Left of No Time to Deviate

content.description: Climb the open-book feature with good edges and stems.  A nice warm-up for stretching out your body, but not for pumping your forearms.
content.location: Immediately left of Sub-Atomic Lunge Blast

content.description: Crux on the bottom can be done by going straight up right of bolt or left and traverse back over. Guidebook says this starts slabby, but it's an very vertical pillar with very tricky moves off the deck. Originally graded 5.7, but crux feels more 5.9 and has left many 5.9 climbers toiling.
content.location: Located to the right of 5.10a The Big Finish. Starts with 2 bolts on a block that looks like a pillar but is part of the wall with yellow stone to the right of it.

content.description: An ok, short moderate.  Move left of the bolt line near the beginning and again up higher to keep it at the grade.
content.location: On the short wall left of the section with Nazi Boyfriend and Frank Black.  Left of My New Hammer.

content.description: Climb solid rock with good holds past five pink/red bolts.
content.location: westernmost route on Millennium Wall, left of Taking it Easy

content.description: Solid rock and fun moves.  Has some standard Vantage slopey-the-wrong-way holds, requiring good footwork and body position.
content.location: Between Sub-Atomic Lunge Blast and Ten-A-Cee Waltz

content.description: A little more engaging and perhaps more straightforward than its neighbor.  Enjoy rock with good friction in the second half after a characteristically Vantage slopey start.
content.location: Right of Play and Win on the wall left of Nazi Boyfriend

content.description:
Guidebook: "Climb the rare finger crack with good finger locks up high, gear to two inches"

While none of the route is exclusively crack climbing, the bottom two thirds has extensive face features to the point where it would be inhibitive to get sucked into the crack.

Also the bottom half is not nearly as well protected as the top half.  Bring some small nuts with you as they protect the bottom fairly well
content.protection:
Small to med. nuts

Gear from 2" camalot on down.

Anchors at top are a strange chain only arrangement straight on the bolts with no hangers so be careful if setting up for top rope.
content.location: Just to the right of Heel High or Crescent.

content.description: This climb has a slabby start on red colored rock. As you get higher, the rock starts to get steeper with the crux near the top.
content.location: Directly to the left of Play and Win

content.description: Really easy route that helps make this wall more beginner group friendly.
content.protection: 4 bolts and chain anchor. Also has rap rings.
content.location: Two routes to the right of the 5.10a The Big Finish. The last bolted route in this section of wall.

climbs.name: Hidden Opulent
climbs.fa: jim Yoder, Marlene Ford, Paul Strauss, Oct. 1999

content.description: a good warm up for the two great 10c's to the right.
content.location: on the right side of the buttress that has Frank Black. Left of Soft Talk- the 5.9 on the left side of the next wall.

content.description:
Super fun climb.  Crux is after the fourth bolt, getting up to the ledge (& passed it).  Involves some balancey big moves & reaches, especially for the vertically challenged.

Use caution when heading to the chains as it's not quite over yet -- must navigate a sloping bulge with limited hands (best hands to the right).

climbs.name: Gas Sipper
climbs.fa: Marlene Ford, Jim Yoder, Dave Sterpin,

content.description: Stem and faceclimb through positive holds past 5 bolts to chain anchors.
content.location: Bolted line immediately right of Lucky Dogs.  Shares chains with The Big Finish.

content.description: Steep and sequential moves gently trending leftwards.  It eases up after you get about half-way up.
content.protection:
7 bolts

Be sure to clip the 3rd bolt (which protects the crux) with the gate on the bolt hanger facing right. If the gate faces left,

it will open all the way

when weighted, which could be very bad if falling from the crux above it.
content.location: Immediately right of Nazi Boyfriend, on the right side of the Millennium Wall, under the prow of Canadian Handjob.

climbs.name: The Big Finish
climbs.fa: Marlene Ford, Jim Yoder, Dave Sterpin,

content.description: Fun face climbing on mostly solid rock past 5 bolts to chain anchors.
content.location: immediately right of Gas Sipper (shares chain anchor)

content.description: Tough moves off the ground give way to easier, enjoyable climbing above.
